page.title: 18 CUDHAM - BLACKSMITH'S FORGE
page.content: The Forge, celebrated in the name of the village pub, is at least 200 years old and only shod horses until 1948. The blacksmith now makes swords and sheaths which are later covered with gold and studded with jewels. He also makes surgical instruments in addition to general blacksmith's work. The forge burns special forge "beans" and is bellowed by an electric fan. The smith uses black iron, stainless steel, and mild steel in his work, fashioning the metal with hand tools. To make wrought iron scrolls he picks up a bar of iron with his tongs and then places it in the forge for about 20 seconds before taking it out and attaching it to a special instrument with which he shapes the curves.
